aiAnalysis.summary: AFJ Limited's staging environment demonstrates strong authentication controls with all admin endpoints properly protected (403 responses), and SSL/TLS is correctly configured. However, there is a critical gap in security headers across multiple pages. Four pages are missing essential security headers, particularly X-Content-Type-Options and X-Frame-Options, which are fundamental defenses against MIME sniffing and clickjacking attacks respectively. Additionally, recommended headers like Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy, and Permissions-Policy are absent across all tested pages, leaving the application vulnerable to common web-based attacks.
recommendations: Immediately implement X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff header on all pages to prevent MIME type sniffing attacks
Add X-Frame-Options: SAMEORIGIN (or DENY if embedding is not required) to all pages to protect against clickjacking; note that /admin already has this set correctly
Deploy Strict-Transport-Security header with appropriate max-age value (minimum 31536000 seconds) to enforce HTTPS-only communication
Implement Content-Security-Policy header with a strict policy tailored to your application's needs to mitigate XSS and injection attacks
Add Referrer-Policy header (recommend 'strict-origin-when-cross-origin') to control information leakage in referrer headers
Configure Permissions-Policy header to restrict access to sensitive browser features
Apply these security headers consistently across all pages using a centralized configuration (middleware or web server configuration) to ensure maintainability
